refnamediv.refpurpose: initialize SSL library by registering algorithms

refsection.title: DESCRIPTION
refsection.para: SSL_library_init() registers the available SSL/TLS ciphers and digests.
OpenSSL_add_ssl_algorithms() and SSLeay_add_ssl_algorithms() are synonyms for SSL_library_init().

refsection.title: NOTES
refsection.para: SSL_library_init() must be called before any other action takes place. SSL_library_init() is not reentrant.

refsection.title: WARNING
refsection.para: SSL_library_init() adds ciphers and digests used directly and indirectly by SSL/TLS.

refsection.title: EXAMPLES
refsection.para: A typical TLS/SSL application will start with the library initialization, and provide readable error messages.
refsection.screen: SSL_load_error_strings(); /* readable error messages */ SSL_library_init(); /* initialize library */

refsection.title: RETURN VALUES
refsection.para: SSL_library_init() always returns "1", so it is safe to discard the return value.

refsection.title: NOTES
refsection.para: OpenSSL 0.9.8o and 1.0.0a and later added SHA2 algorithms to SSL_library_init(). Applications which need to use SHA2 in earlier versions of OpenSSL should call OpenSSL_add_all_algorithms() as well.
